thread.title: Gas prices down slightly in metro Savannah
thread.title_full: Gas prices down slightly in metro Savannah | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: Gas prices down slightly in metro Savannah
text:
By Savannah Morning News
Average retail gasoline prices in Savannah have fallen 1.4 cents a gallon in the past week to $2.17 a gallon on Sunday, according to GasBuddy’s daily survey of 262 gas outlets in Savannah.
The national average has fallen 5.4 cents a gallon in the last week to $2.26, according to gasoline price website GasBuddy.com.
Prices Sunday in the Savannah area were 79.1 cents a gallon lower than one year ago and are 2.6 cents a gallon higher than a month ago. The national average has decreased 3.7 cents a gallon during the last month and stands 84.5 cents lower than a year ago.
“Falling gasoline prices have been the name of the game after a brief hiatus,” said Patrick DeHaan, senior petroleum analyst for GasBuddy.com. “Forty-nine of the nation’s 50 states saw gasoline prices falling an average of six cents a gallon during the last week, while the Midwest, previously hit with price spikes, saw among the biggest declines as some refiners returned from maintenance, easing supply concerns.
“Oil prices also took a break after seeing the largest weekly increase since 2009 to post a big decrease last week.”
DeHaan said the gasoline price environment remains vastly improved versus a year ago.
“Just 13.4 percent of the nation’s gas stations are selling at over $2.50 a gallon today, while a year ago, 100 percent of stations were over that mark,” he said. “Nearly a quarter of the nation’s gasoline stations are currently selling under $2 a gallon, and that number will likely grow in the months ahead as refiners continue to finish maintenance and resume producing gasoline at a time when demand is low, contributing downward pressure to gasoline prices.”
For a complete listing of current averages and other fuel price data, visit http://media.gasbuddy.com.
